translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on the head🔽1. The training rule on swaying the head

original: 20. Dutiyasīsappacālakasikkhāpada🔽Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: dutiya sīsa pacālaka sikkhāpada  tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sīsappacālakaṁ antaraghare nisīdanti sīsaṁ olambentā …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū sīsappacālakam antara ghare nisīdanti sīsam olambentā pe
translated: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their heads while sitting in inhabited areas. …

analyzed: na sīsa pacālakam antara ghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not sway my head while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not sway one’s head while sitting in an inhabited area.
One should sit with one’s head erect.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca sīsappacālakaṁ antaraghare nisīdati sīsaṁ olambento, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca,
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca sīsappacālakam antaraghare nisīdati sīsam olambento āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his head while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,
if he is sick,🔽if he is traveling,🔽if there is a danger,
if he is the first offender.🔽The tenth training rule is finished.
The second sub-chapter on the head is finished.
